title: Opt out of Duo's
body:
Can we get an option to opt out of having Duo's in our games for ranked?

Duo's always fuck up the game in my experience cause either one the duo's is smurfing/boosting and the other isn't, or the duo is just trolling and not communicating.

Still yet to have a good game with a duo involved in it.

replies.body:
This video explains it pretty well, while changes have occurred to how picking works (to favor duo's creating a duopoly on picks) it still outlines why its such a bad thing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6IKihzPey20

Δ I play plenty of duos and trios, and the only extra communication I have with my premades are a bunch of lame inside jokes and funny recollections + comments

It's not like we're an evil secret club or something. Δ

The good duos are the ones you don't even notice

As a note, this is more related to ranked, the fact you said Trios, means your indicating normals, and in normals it's fine, i don't care about playing against other Premades in normals because it's unlikely to be that major of a problem.

The problem comes in ranked where Duo's do one of 2 things.
1. Bring another (probably more experienced) duo into the game for the enemy team, more often then not this could easily be a boosting duo, meaning that your more then likely going to lose because more or less your Duo is inexperienced.
2. Make the entire enemy team better players, now well this isn't inherently a bad thing, the fact that an all gold 5 team would go against an all gold 4 team simply because the gold 5 team has a duo that thought they were good isn't a good thing.

Duo's tend to ruin the game's they are in whether it's because their more intent on fucking around or what.
I share this dislike of duos! #supportproblems

I definitely agree. My main roles are support and adc but when there are duos (even in last pick), they act they have a divine right to botlane. It is super frustrating. 

If I had the choice I would never play with a duo in my game.

I disagree, duo's generally have a clear advantage when playing together if they know each other and have played together. Knowing how your adc/support plays and being able to compensate for their strengths/waeknesses is a massive advantage in a lane. I personally always let duo's lane together if they want to on this premise.

Hint: 9/10 duos haven't played to the extent they should before they duo, if you don't have a good 20-50 games with that person, then you probably don't know them as well as you should.

Not to mention, the other duo could have a lot more experience or a lot less synergy wise, not to mention they could be smurfs, in my opinion it just makes the balance of power shift way too much between 4 members of the game (2 on each team)
